title: Nuclear Fallout Exposure Safety Timetable
brief: Precise timing schedule for safe movement and exposure in nuclear fallout areas.
steps: Step 1: Complete isolation for 4-6 days following delivery of last nuclear weapon.
Step 2: Day 3: One brief exposure up to 30 minutes maximum to procure water only.
Step 3: Day 7: One exposure not exceeding 30 minutes for essential tasks.
Step 4: Day 8: One exposure not exceeding 1 hour for necessary activities.
Step 5: Days 9-12: Exposure of 2-4 hours maximum for essential survival tasks.
Step 6: Day 13 onward: Normal operation followed by rest in protected shelter.
Step 7: Decontaminate at every stop outside shelter.
Step 8: Consider only mandatory requirements as valid reasons for exposure.
warnings: These times are conservative - forced movement after day 1-2 is possible but dangerous.
Make all exposures as brief as absolutely necessary.
Extended exposure during early days can result in lethal radiation doses.
source: FM 21-76 US Army Survival Manual — U.S. Department of the Army (Chapter 23 - Survival in Man-Made Hazards)
